sen.j: 右京区（うきょうく）は、京都市を構成する11区のひとつ。
sen.e: The Ukyo Ward is one of the 11 wards that comprise Kyoto City.
The Ukyo Ward is one of the 11 wards that comprise Kyoto City.
The Ukyo Ward is one of the eleven wards that constitute Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 市内西北部に位置し、旧京北町合併後は京都市の区の中では最大の面積である（それまでは左京区が最大だった）。
sen.e: Located in the north west part of Kyoto City, it is the largest ward of all the wards of Kyoto City after merger of former Keihoku-cho. (The Sakyo Ward was the largest.)
Located in the north west part of Kyoto City, it is the largest ward of all the wards of Kyoto City after merging of the former Keihoku-cho took place. (The Sakyo Ward was the largest.)
Located in the north west part of Kyoto City, it is the largest ward of all the wards of Kyoto City after merging of the former Keihoku-cho took place (the Sakyo Ward was the largest.)
sen.cmt: 一つの文章にしました。

sen.j: 区南部は古くは都の皇族や公家の別荘が点在していたが、現在は主として住宅地になっている。
sen.e: The southern part of the ward, once an area dotted with villas of imperial families, has become principally a residence area.
The southern part of the ward, once an area dotted with villas of imperial families, is now mainly a residential area.
The southern part of the ward, once an area dotted with villas of imperial families and court nobles, is now mainly a residential area.
sen.cmt: 公家 を追加しました。

sen.j: 区西部や北部は山間地である。
sen.e: The western and northern parts are mountainous regions.
The western and northern parts are mountainous regions.
The western and northern parts are mountainous regions.

sen.j: かつては山国郷（京北山国・黒田地区）の木材が桂川を下り、下流の嵯峨・梅津などで陸揚げされて京都に運ばれた。
sen.e: Wood timbers of Yamaguni-go (Keihoku Yamaguni and Kuroda area) were once carried downstream by the Katsura-gawa River and landed at Saga or Umezu for transporting them to Kyoto.
Wood from Yamaguni-go (Keihoku Yamaguni and Kuroda area) were once carried downstream by the Katsura-gawa River and landed at Saga or Umezu for transportation to Kyoto.
Wood from Yamaguni-go (Keihoku Yamaguni and Kuroda area) were once carried downstream by the Katsura-gawa River and landed at Saga or Umezu for transportation to Kyoto.

sen.j: 河川：桂川 (淀川水系)（上桂川、保津川、保津峡）、天神川 (京都市)、有栖川、弓削川
sen.e: Rivers: Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River System) (Kamikatsura-gawa River, Hozu-gawa River, Hozu-kyo Gorge), Tenjin-gawa River (Kyoto City), Arisugawa, Yuge-gawa River
Rivers: Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River System) (Kamikatsura-gawa River, Hozu-gawa River, Hozu-kyo Gorge), Tenjin-gawa River (Kyoto City), Arisugawa, Yuge-gawa River
Rivers: Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system) (Kamikatsura-gawa River, Hozu-gawa River, Hozu-kyo Gorge), Tenjin-gawa River (Kyoto City), Arisu-gawa River, Yuge-gawa River

sen.j: 山地：愛宕山 (京都市)、小倉山、岩田山
sen.e: Mountains: Mt. Atago (Kyoto city), Ogura-yama Mountain, Iwata-yama Mountain
Mountains: Mt. Atago (Kyoto city), Ogura-yama Mountain, Iwata-yama Mountain
Mountains: Mt. Atago (Kyoto city), Mt. Ogura, Mt. Iwata

sen.j: 区北部の京北は全域が丹波高原に当たる。
sen.e: The northern part of the ward, Keihoku, belongs to Tanba highland.
The northern part of the ward, Keihoku, belongs to Tanba highland.
The northern part of the ward, Keihoku, belongs to Tanba highland.

sen.j: 旧京北町の町役場が置かれた周山と宇津が主な盆地だが、その他は山地で、この盆地をつなぐように桂川が流れる。
sen.e: Almost all of this part is mountainous except main basins, Shuzan--the former site of Keihoku town office-and Uzu, and the Katsura-gawa River runs as if it connects these basins.
Almost the entire region is mountainous except the main basins, Shuzan--the former site of Keihoku town office-and Uzu, and the Katsura-gawa River runs as if it connects these basins.
Almost the entire region is mountainous except the main basins, Shuzan--the former site of Keihoku town office-and Uzu, and the Katsura-gawa River runs as if it connects these basins.

sen.j: 区南部は、北方の山岳部を除いては桂川に沿っており、ほぼ平坦である。
sen.e: The southern part of the ward is almost flat along the Katsura-gawa River except the northern mountainous regions.
The southern part of the ward is almost flat along the Katsura-gawa River except for the northern mountainous regions.
The southern part of the ward is almost flat along the Katsura-gawa River except for the northern mountainous regions.

sen.j: 京北は編入前から右京区と周山街道（国道162号）や桂川によって結ばれていた。
sen.e: Keihoku was connected with Kyoto City by the Shuzan Kaido Road (National Highway Route No. 162) or the Katsura-gawa River before the merger of Keihoku.
Keihoku was connected with Kyoto City by the Shuzan Kaido Road (National Highway Route No. 162) or the Katsura-gawa River before the merger of Keihoku.
Keihoku was connected with Ukyo Ward by the Shuzan Kaido Road (National Route 162) or the Katsura-gawa River before the merger of Keihoku.

sen.j: 現在の右京区がある地域の歴史は古く、かつてこの地には山城国府が置かれていた。
sen.e: The region of the present-day Ukyo Ward has a long history; once it was the site of ancient provincial capital of Yamashiro.
The region of the present-day Ukyo Ward has a long history; it was once the site of the ancient provincial capital of Yamashiro.
The region of the present-day Ukyo Ward has a long history; it was once the site of the ancient provincial capital of Yamashiro.

sen.j: 渡来人の秦氏もこの地方を拠点として活躍したと思われ、氏寺として広隆寺を建立した。
sen.e: The Hata clan, an immigrant, is believed to have played an active role based on this region and founded Koryu-ji Temple as their Ujidera, or family temple.
The Hata clan, immigrants, are believed to have played an active role in this region and founded Koryu-ji Temple as their Ujidera, or family temple.
The Hata clan, immigrants, are believed to have played an active role in this region and founded Koryu-ji Temple as their Ujidera, or family temple.

sen.j: 秦氏は聖徳太子とも関わりがあったらしく、のちの山背大兄王が蘇我氏に攻められた際には、彼に太秦に避難するよう進言する者があった。
sen.e: The Hata clan seems to have a relationship with Prince Shotoku; he was advised to escape to Uzumasa when Yamashiro-no-one was attacked by the Soga clan.
The Hata clan seems to have a relationship with Prince Shotoku; he was advised to escape to Uzumasa when Yamashiro-no-one was attacked by the Soga clan.
The Hata clan seems to have a relationship with Prince Shotoku; he was advised to escape to Uzumasa when Yamashiro-no-one was attacked by the Soga clan.

sen.j: 秦氏と関係の深い桓武天皇が宇多に新都を定めると、京中に寺の建立が禁止されていたために、現在の右京区域にも多くの寺社が立ち並んだ。
sen.e: When Emperor Kammu having a close tie with the Hata clan founded a capital in Uda, many temples were founded in present-day Ukyo region because building temples were banned in the central Kyo.
When Emperor Kammu, who had close ties with the Hata clan, founded a capital in Uda, many temples were founded in present-day Ukyo, due to a ban on building temples in the central Kyo.
When Emperor Kanmu, who had close ties with the Hata clan, founded a capital in Uda, many temples were founded in present-day Ukyo, due to a ban on building temples in the central Kyo.

sen.j: 嵯峨天皇が嵯峨離宮（後の大覚寺）を建てたりするなど多くの貴族はこの地に馴染み、また嵐山に遊んだ。
sen.e: Emperor Saga built Saga-rikyu (Imperial villa) (later Daikaku-ji Temple) and many other nobles adopted themselves to this area and enjoyed themselves in Arashiyma.
Emperor Saga built Saga-rikyu (Imperial villa) (later Daikaku-ji Temple) and many other nobles adopted the area, enjoying themselves in Arashiyma.
Emperor Saga built Saga-rikyu (Imperial villa) (later Daikaku-ji Temple) and many other nobles adopted the area, enjoying themselves in Arashiyma.

sen.j: 戦国時代以降より桂川水運が盛んとなり、嵯峨周辺に豪商が成長した。
sen.e: After the age of civil war, businesses of transporting goods by the Katsura-gawa River began to flourish and wealthy merchants arose,
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After the age of civil war,transportation businesses by the Katsura-gawa River began to flourish, giving rise to wealthy merchanges.
After the age of Sengoku period (period of warring states), transportation businesses by the Katsura-gawa River began to flourish, giving rise to wealthy merchants.
sen.cmt: 戦国時代→Sengoku period (period of warring states) としました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: その中で嵐山の豪商角倉了以が徳川幕府と結びつき、各地の河川の開削を行った。
sen.e: One of such merchants is Ryoi SUMINOKURA, who had a close connection with the Tokugawa shogunate and built rivers or canals in various areas.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: One such merchant is Ryoi SUMINOKURA, who had a close connection with the Tokugawa shogunate and built rivers or canals in various areas.
One such merchant is Ryoi SUMINOKURA in Arashiyama, who had a close connection with the Tokugawa shogunate and built rivers or canals in various areas.
sen.cmt: 嵐山 を追加しました。

sen.j: このためか角倉家は大いに発展し、東南アジアにまで進出するに至る。
sen.e: This is partly because the Suminokura family thrived, making an inroad to South East Asia.
This is partly because the Suminokura family thrived, making inroads to South East Asia.
The Suminokura family thrived, making inroads as far as to Southeast Asia.

sen.j: 鎖国以後も桂川水運の管理を任され、現在の南丹市世木より下流の、桂川の重要な港には角倉役所が置かれた。
sen.e: After national isolation the family continued to have control over the transport by the Katsura-gawa River and established Suminokura Yakusho Office at every key port of the river lower than present-day Seki Nantan City.

After national isolation the family continued to have control over transportation in the Katsura-gawa River and established the Suminokura Yakusho Office at every key port of the river lower than the present-day Seki Nantan City.

After national isolation the family continued to have control over transportation in the Katsura-gawa River and established the Suminokura Yakusho Office at every key port of the river lower than the present-day Seki, Nantan City.
sen.cmt: Seki, Nantan City としました。

sen.j: 桂川の水運は嵐山や梅津を荷揚場とし、天神川を水路として丹波以北からの品物を京都中に運んだ。
sen.e: Using water transport of the Katsura-gawa River, goods produced in northern Tanba were carried via the Tenjin-gawa River between the delivery ports the Arashiyama and Tanba.
Using water transportation via the Katsura-gawa River, goods produced in northern Tanba were carried through the Tenjin-gawa River between the delivery ports Arashiyama and Tanba.
Using water transportation via the Katsura-gawa River, goods produced in northern Tanba were carried through the Tenjin-gawa River between the delivery ports Arashiyama and Tanba.

sen.j: 京北地区の歴史としては、平安京造営の際に木材を献上した山国郷が歴史上最初に現れる。
sen.e: Yamaguni-go is the first seen in the history of Keihoku as a donor of the wood timbers for constructing Heiankyo.
Yamaguni-go was first seen in the history of Keihoku as a donor of wood for constructing Heiankyo.
Yamaguni-go was first seen in the history of Keihoku as a donor of wood for constructing Heian-kyo.

sen.j: これが基となって朝廷に縁を持ち、南北朝時代には光厳天皇が山国郷に一寺を開いた。
sen.e: This brought about the relationship between the area and the imperial court, leading to the foundation of a temple in Yamaguni-go by Emperor Kogon.
This brought about a relationship between the area and the imperial court, leading to the founding of a temple in Yamaguni-go by Emperor Kogon.
This brought about a relationship between the area and the imperial court, leading to the founding of a temple in Yamaguni-go by Emperor Kogon.

sen.j: 戦国時代には土豪宇津氏が当地に割拠したが、明智光秀の攻撃を受けて滅んだ。
sen.e: During the age of civil war the local Uzu clan made its own territory in this area but was perished in the attack of Mitsuhide AKECHI.
During the age of civil war the local Uzu clan made its own territory in this area but perished in an attack by Mitsuhide AKECHI.
During the age of Sengoku period the local Uzu clan made its own territory in this area but perished in an attack by Mitsuhide AKECHI.

sen.j: また明治維新の際には時代祭行列で知られる山国隊が当地の農民により編成され、官軍に参加し活躍した。
sen.e: Also Yamaguni-tai, which is now famous for its Jidai Matsuri Parade, was formed by local farmers to participate in the imperial army and played an active role in the Meiji Restoration.
Also Yamaguni-tai, which is now famous for its Jidai Matsuri Parade, was formed by local farmers to participate in the imperial army and played an active role in the Meiji Restoration.
Also Yamaguni-tai, which is now famous for its Jidai Matsuri Parade, was formed by local farmers to participate in the imperial army and played an active role in the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 1931年（昭和6年）4月1日 葛野郡嵯峨町、太秦村、花園村、西院村、梅津村、京極村、梅ヶ畑村、松尾村、桂村、川岡村が京都市に編入、右京区が誕生。
sen.e: On April 1, 1931, the Ukyo Ward was founded through a merger of Saga-cho Kadono-gun, Uzumasa-mura, Hanazono-mura. Sai-mura. Umezu-mura, Kyogoku-mura, Umegahata-mura, Matsuo-mura, Katsura-mura, and Kawaoka-muraa with Kyoto City.

On April 1, 1931, the Ukyo Ward was founded through a merger of Saga-cho Kadono-gun, Uzumasa-mura, Hanazono-mura. Sai-mura. Umezu-mura, Kyogoku-mura, Umegahata-mura, Matsuo-mura, Katsura-mura, and Kawaoka-muraa with Kyoto City.

April 1, 1931: The Ukyo Ward was founded through a merger of Saga-cho Kadono-gun, Uzumasa-mura, Hanazono-mura, Sai-mura, Umezu-mura, Kyogoku-mura, Umegahata-mura, Matsuo-mura, Katsura-mura, and Kawaoka-mura with Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: ピリオドをカンマに変更しました。スペルを修正しました。"On April 1, 1931, the"→"April 1, 1931: The"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1950年（昭和25年）12月1日 乙訓郡大枝村を編入。
sen.e: On December 1, 1950, Oe-mura Otokunin-gun was merged.
On December 1, 1950, Oe-mura Otokunin-gun was merged.
sen.cmt: Otokuni-gunに修正しました。"On December 1, 1950,"→"December 1, 1950:"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1959年（昭和34年）11月1日 乙訓郡大原野村を編入。
sen.e: On November 1, 1959, Oharano-mura Otokuni-gun was merged.
On November 1, 1959, Oharano-mura Otokuni-gun was merged.
sen.cmt: カンマ追加しました。"On November 1, 1959,"→"November 1, 1959:"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1976年（昭和51年）10月1日 右京区から西京区が分区（松尾、桂、川岡、大枝、大原野地区は西京区へ）。
sen.e: On October 1, 1976, the Nishi-kyo Ward was separated from the Ukyo Ward (Matsuo, Katsura, Kawaoka, Oe and Oharano area belonged to Nishi-kyo Ward.)
On October 1, 1976, the Nishi-kyo Ward was separated from the Ukyo Ward (Matsuo, Katsura, Kawaoka, Oe and Oharano area belonged to Nishi-kyo Ward.)
October 1, 1976: The Nishikyo Ward was separated from the Ukyo Ward (Matsuo, Katsura, Kawaoka, Oe and Oharano area belonged to Nishikyo Ward.)
sen.cmt: Nishikyo Wardとしました。"On October 1, 1976, the"→"October 1, 1976: The"に変更しました。

sen.j: 2005年（平成17年）4月1日 北桑田郡京北町を編入。
sen.e: On April 1, 2005, Keihoku-cho Kitakuwada-gun was merged.
On April 1, 2005, Keihoku-cho Kitakuwada-gun was merged.

sen.cmt: 小タイトル用に変更しました。

sen.j: 右京区役所（総合庁舎）は、太秦広隆寺駅前から、地下鉄東西線太秦天神川駅（駅はすでに開業）併設の建物SANSA右京に移転した。
sen.e: The Ukyo Ward Office (government complex building) was relocated from a building in front of Uzumasa Koryuji Station to SANSA Ukyo, a complex facility.
The Ukyo Ward Office (government complex building) was relocated from a building in front of Uzumasa Koryuji Station to SANSA Ukyo, a complex facility.

The Ukyo Ward Office (government complex building) was relocated from a building in front of Uzumasa Koryuji Station to SANSA Ukyo, a complex facility within the Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station of Kyoto Municipal Subway Tozai Line.
